title: Incredibly beautiful palace hotel in the heart of Jaisalmer
review: My favorite hotel in our recent trip.  It is a palace, the family still live in part of it.  Staying within such beauty is a rare thing, would 100% recommend this hotel to friends.  Had a lovely pool and the food really was excellent.  We have stayed in 4 Welcome Heritage hotels now and they have all been different but great.  Wifi not great but that should not put you off staying.  Also has a great rooftop restaurant.

title: Beautiful place must stay here
review: One of the most beautiful places I have stayed. Very courteous staff and helpful. Must visit the terrace restaurant which gives you a beautiful view of Jaisalmer Fort- and the food is delicious.

title: Staying in a former Maharajah Palace
review: Great place to explore Jaisalmer. Impressive building, nice rooms and a super view on Jaisalmer fort, either from the balcony of our room or the rooftop restaurant, where we had dinner twice. Nice people.

title: Best place with quality services
review: We choose to stay at the hotel in a situation when we were short of accommodation. We personally visited the property to look for accommodation and get connected with Mr. Bhojraj Singh who handles the booking and all other related stuff. He offered us quality services in competitive price in Kalyan Bhawan (subsidiary of Heritage Mandir Palace) for 4 rooms in such a crisis situation and peak season in Jaisalmer. He handles both Mandir Palace (heritage) and Kalyan Bhawan (best place with economic prices) property. He is of very helping nature and stand by his commitments. The breakfast was also of great quality and variety. The staff at restaurant was also friendly. I will definitely recommend this place to stay. FYI we were group of 9 adults and 2 young kids (2, 7 yr). It was very easy for us to get food for kids as per our customization because of helping staff working under supervision of Mr. Bhojraj Singh Ji.

title: Not value for money....nothing special...
review: Ticket price is very high but not worth it...there is very small section for tourists...major section is hotel and private guest....if you want to take only selfies or photo then go otherwise it is wasting of money....very small place with high cost...not worth it really

title: Wonderfully maintained place
review: It is a great place for good foots.  Very well maintained and well mannered assistants to explain details

title: Beautiful heritage Motel,  perfect for family of 6 including grandma
review: Thank you to the Mandir Palace management and staff who looked after our family so beautifully.  We really appreciated your genuine care and concern, and thoughtful manners.  Want to stay again!

title: Nice place
review: So nice place to explore Jaisalmer, Impressive building with beautiful carving, super view of Jaisalmer fort, all staff members are so Nice.

title: Do not go-tourist place but waste
review: This is a not so interesting history place as it's portrayed, the tickets are costly. The place can be covered in 15 mins ; displays lots of things from some kingdom like utensils camera furniture photographs etc.

title: We visited and wish we stayed
review: The architecture is what brings the place to life. The museum is ok ok but the true magic is in the building itself.

title: Beautiful temples and museum.
review: We stayed here, hence had access to the temples and the museum. Some of the artifacts were beautiful. The place has lot of temples too.

title: Overhyped place - DO NOT VISIT
review: One can easily NOT VISIT this highly commerical place. Every section of the haveli has been divided and is being used for commercial reasons.

title: More and More Vaishnav must visit Mandir Palace
review: Being vaishnav we were in serch of Bethakji but coudnot know how really call this place so its take time to reach there. But it is known as Mandir Palace. Also current location of existing king. Atleast worth spending fort visit.

title: Medieval Charm
review: I went to Mandir Palace. Mandir Palace offers a concoction of medieval charm with the modern amenities. The main portion of the two centuries old WelcomHeritage Mandir Palace was built during the reign of the late Maharawal Jawahir Singh. It is great place to go.

title: Beautiful hotel in Jaisalmer
review: This beautiful heritage hotel is in a very good location in Jaisalmer. Rooms were clean and staff attentive, thanks to Bhojraj Singh the hotel manager who was very helpful during our stay.

title: Historical Hotel Palace Of Jaisalmer!
review: This is a hotel,a Visitors attraction and home of the royal family.There are three parts.One part is for the royal family which is out of bounds for general public.The other part is hotel and museum part.if  you want to visit the mandir and the museum there are are some extra charges for entry .If you are staying in hotel then you don't need to pay anything for the Museum.The hotel room is good and the hotel service is excellent.The bathrooms are clean and well maintained.There is a swimming pool too.The restaurant here serves good food but expect the prices to be on the higher side.Around 400 rupees for every mains dish.The biffet breakfast does not habe many optioms but the service is great.Well overall the hospitality was great and we felt like we were staying in a palace.Overall it was a GOOD EXPERIENCE!

title: Private collection and ticket price is high
review: It is just a private palace and created as museum for earning money. No big attraction. Jawhar mahal has some furniture's which is common un all the fort museums. Only place which I have liked is Giridhari temple

title: A Palace Hotel In Jaisalmer
review: The Mandir Palace is right in the Heart of the City, The Rooms are good, the Roof Top Restaurant has an Excellent View of the Fort, The Morning View or the Evening or the Night View of the Fort is Feast to the Eyes.

title: Do not go
review: Terrible. Normal taste, tiny food, and extremely high cost. Mineral water is 80Rs in here. A cup of lassi is 180Rs.

title: Good rooms, food is expensive
review: We spent 2 days at the mandir palace heritage hotel in Jaisalmer. I loved the room, very well maintained and the staff is very good. Don’t compare them to a hotel like Taj or Oberoi but they did a good job. It’s centrally located so most of the places like the main fort is just within walking distance. The only issue is the cost of food if you decide to dine at the hotel. We took one meal at this hotel and one at the Marriott, trust me, Marriott was cheaper as compared to Mandir palace.

title: Highly overpriced. Very little to see inside the palace
review: There is hardly anything to see inside. Avoid if you can. But if you have this compulsion of visiting and checking it off your list of visited places, make sure you take a ticket for photography. The only good thing here is you can take good photos of the intricate carvings. Its an absolute overhyped place. for 100 rs. Half of the place is closed as it is converted into a hotel.

title: Worst service and highly overpriced
review: Really really exp expensive and poorest service. Don’t recommend this restaurant to anyone. The food was also not good.

title: Hotel cum Palace
review: Good if you are staying. Other wise no point in visiting. Over priced food as well as other charges. Its where the current maharajas reside

title: Not a surely recommended. Visit only if you have time
review: The mandir palace architecture is good. But after you enter as a visitor you cannot enter to many places inside palace as it is restricted to hotel residents only. The ticket is too overpriced around 200 compared to places you visit inside. You are not allowed to take pics at some places as it is the private property of some RAJA.

title: a waste of time and money
review: this is really disappointing as the ticket is highly over-priced nd there is practically very minimal to see inside. the architecture is good from outside but not worth the time. it could be a good idea to visit this place to understand how the maharajas used to fool the public at that time and is still doing the same as most part of the palace is coverted to hoitel and a major portion is still held by the royal family and a very small part is open to public.

title: palace is good but not open for tourists
review: only a small area is open for tourists as government has to intervene and open the palace for tourists

title: Definitely avoidable
review: Average rooms ; below average service ...avoid if possible. Not suitable for families with children wanting to have a relaxing time.

title: Superb Experience
review: My wife and I visited Jaisalmer along with with another couple (German Friends).

title: Great location and lovely heritage site
review: Stayed for 2 nights in light of booked Camel safari. Fabulous location, close to city centre. Recommend that you undertake the house tour to understand the heritage and history of the hotel. However suggest you eat out, at the opposite roof top terrace restaurant.

title: Good Hotel
review: It's been some time since I wrote a review.

title: Royal palace
review: Actual home of current royals of Jaisalmer.

title: A palace in heart of the city
review: The Mandir palace is situated in the heart of city adjacent to the Gandhi chowk. The part of the palace has been converted into a 5star hotel and and some part is being used as a good small museum displaying art work,old utensils and other items of forgone era. The place is worth visiting and take some good snaps as a memory of the city.

title: A nice Restaurant !
review: They have a nice upscale restaurant here and hence you can go here for a nice meal. Not to mention Jaisalmer has such nice architecture that you will never be short of pictures.

title: Good Architecture Only.. Rude Staff..
review: Extremely Rude Staff. From the gatekeeper to ticket counter the behavior of the staff is very bad. There are horses in the premises and people were keen to look at them or click pics of them. The guard was running behind people with stick & threatening everyone. Its ok if you don't let anyone to go near the horses. But clicking pics that too from a long distance must be totally fine.

title: Ornae balconies, canopies and intricately designed screens
review: Residence of the rulers of Jaisalmer for over 200 years. Badal Vilas is a tall structure made of sandstone, and located at foot of the hill which houses the city fort.

title: Beautiful heritage building with rooftop restaurant
review: A group of friends and I on my intrepid trip went to the castle for dinner on the rooftop. We had candlelight, beautiful view of the city and local music artists playing folk music for us. My friends tried the drums with the band and the food was nice. Only thing to note is it is more western prices $10-15USD per meal

title: awful buffet dinner at very high prices
review: Only the ambience is good. Buffet dinner had terrible choice and just one option for non veg and desert. priced very high. will not recommend

title: Best option in Jaisalmer
review: Pro:

title: A heritage hotel cum haveli
review: Very nice stay. The staff were so hospitable. I stayed here free thanks to my AMEX voucher and the staff were very keen to feature this on my blogging website which I'll definitely do coz its worth it!

title: A truly Indian experience
review: Mr Bhojraj Singh greeted us with the politeness and care we have experienced throughout our travels this same level of service carried through to the entire staff. Our room was clean and decorated with Indian flair. Dinner on the roof top restaurant delicious and enjoyable.

title: the museum and restaurant
review: A beautiful place to visit with appalling architecture turned into museum at a nominal fee. The restaurant has very tasty food.

title: Great heritage place to stay
review: We reached at 11:30 at night and they had their kitchen open just in case we hadn't had our dinner. It was our anniversary trip and we had informed them and they had arranged a cake for us in our room. The staff was well mannered and courteous. The breakfast was not great but decent and hotel itself had 2 museums and is a tourist spot. The museums werent huge but had decent things on display. The palace itself is quite beautiful nd lends itself for some amzing backdrop for pictures. It is a beautiful property and is walking distance from patwa haveli which is another tourist destination. Half of the property is closed for visitors as the king still lives there. Overall a good experience.

title: Not worth it
review: Its not at all worth watching , but there are not much options to watch so its Ok to go there,

title: DO NOT WASTE TIME and MONEY.
review: There are several alternative places in Rajasthan with much better palaces. You cant access most places,. You see very little. Total rip off and more importantly waste of precious time

title: A Beautiful Mansions but authorities in dilemma
review: A astounding piece of art and architecture partly converted to heritage hotel. Authorities seem to be in total dilemma to project it for tourists or the residents. The ticketing staff doesnt know why is he there. Guards are rude and the museum is very basic mostly the daily household commodities used by the queen. Ticketing price philosophy is "loot the tourist" as per custom of Jaisalmer sites and buying or using a camera is a crime here.only the stunning curvings and artwork draws visitors.

title: If you have free time
review: Located in center so if you have free 30-45 mins. You may visit this place. Guide is not necessary. History of things displayed is described. Beautiful carvings on walls that you can notice from the entrance gate itself.

title: A hotel cum museum.
review: Extremely rude guards who make travellers feel unsafe. Charges are Rs30 and separate camera charges. Entry to the zanana mahal has spearate fees and because of the rude behavious from staff we did not bother to visit the zenana mahal.

title: Beautiful place and house of current Royal family and a Hotel
review: The place is partly the current residence of Royal Family of Jaisalmer built with local Yellow stone with mesmerizing architecture and carvings facing the walls of Jaisalmer Fort. Part of it is maintained as a Hotel with decent rooms located next to the Fort and City center. Recommended for a stay while in Jaisalmer with very friendly staff and has two museums showcasing really old artefacts including clothes, utensils, weapons and Jewellery.

title: Palace with a Bollywood Twist
review: This was the place in the movie Sarfarosh.  Hence we wanted to view, since we were nearby.

title: Beautiful heritage hotel
review: The hotel and surrounds were lovely and historic.  The rooms were a bit quirky but well appointed with great WIFI and very comfortable.  We ate dinner at the rooftop restaurant and the food was very nice and suitable for a western palate.  The hotel is centrally located too.

title: Beautiful old palace now a hotel
review: The building of this old palace is lovely. Part is now a museum. The carving, tiles and fretwork was totally palace standard and a complete joy.

title: Luxury hotel cum resort for current Maharaj
review: when royal family visit Jaisalmer, they use to reside in Mandir Mahal. Some of the portion is converted to a Premium Luxury hotel. Good architecture

title: Well Maintained
review: Mandir palace (City palace) is well maintained and houses a luxury hotel, a museum and of course the royal residence. The museum is pretty small, but the place was not swarming with tourists and photo mongers and hence gave us a peaceful 30 minutes to explore the place at our own pace. The Tazia tower is situated here and the exhibits are well preserved.

title: Loved the aura
review: This place seems quiet dramatic that's what please me more the manager of this place is a very gentle person. Felt like I am at a royal palace it was very beautiful.

title: Not worth it
review: IT was not worth the price. The ticket guys was trying to fleece our change and add to it inside also bad behavior all they bothered was to collect money

title: Worst Museum
review: Don't go there. The owner is trying to earn money showing his scrap. The ticket guy sitting there does not know how to behave with tourist. They believed that they favored us showing their scrap. There are two places inside - Jawahir Vilas (Rs 40) & Zanana Mahal Museum (Rs 30).

title: Just a hotel rather than museum
review: Majority of the part is converted into hotel. Only some part is kept as museum, which is also not worth to see. They have kept some of the remaining things left by the royal family and displayed them. If you have time left then only visit this place.

title: This is just like another examples of stone craft
review: The mandir palace is just another marvel of the excellent stone craft of  the times of Indian Rajasthan Royal kings.

title: It's a hotel not open for tourists from inside
review: It's one of the best hotel in jaisalmer. Many people thought it as tourist place,but it is a hotel. One can see outside view and the royal horses in premises.

title: GOOD HERITAGE EXPERINCE!!
review: we have book this property directly from hotel.deposited full amount for three rooms but forgottan to take confirmation and they also did not inform us. when we reached our rooms was not reserved we were tense as diwali vacation every where hotels over booked.but hotel manager was very helpful he manage 02 rooms for us after sometime.

title: Beautiful place
review: Unless you are a guest at the hotel you can only walk around the grounds but this is still worth a visit when in Jaisalmer. Great views from the top. Many historic objects to look at.

title: An Architectural Gem-Palace Hotel
review: It is a fantastic heritage palace converted in to a royal hotel.The hotel is nicely located in the heart of the city and is major tourist attraction for all visiting Jaisalmer.Tourists have limited access but one can enjoy the architectural stone carving beauty in the purest form.

title: Owners Indifference make it a strict no
review: I was very disappointed with jaiselmer's attitude of charging hefty entrance fee for all the monumnets. Further, all the monumnets are mostly privately owned and they exploit the gullible tourists to the fullest of extent.

title: royal feeling
review: hotel is a heritage hotel and when you stay there you feel like  you are guest of a royal family. rooms are quite luxurious spacious neat and clean.I must say value for money.

title: Mandir Palace
review: Museum like palace, charming in its pristine glory. Intricately designed carvings also preserved excellently by the locals.

title: In the heart of Jaisalmer
review: Situated in the heart of Jaisalmer this is a heritage hotel that was a treat. Well appointed rooms, clean and comfortable. Good restaurant. A lot of stairs and narrow passages.The common wash rooms were not very clean

title: Historical value
review: Hotel is a heritage hotel and when you stay there you feel like you are guest of a royal family. We were upgraded to a Suite as it was my wife's birthday and they gave us a pleasent surprise. The staff was very courteous and helpful. This is where the ex-royal family lives. Half the place is their abode, the other half is converted to a hotel. Its very nice architecture.Take your time to walk through the palace, it has the weapons, clothing, utensils etc used by the emperors. There are beautiful historical photographs.

title: Mr & Mrs
review: Very nice hotel. The manager Bhoj Raj Singh was very helpful in every way he told us a story of his bosses wedding in 2014 he also showed us a couple of pictures and gave us a little history lesson on the hotel very interesting.Beautiful food and very clean. The staff are very friendly especially the waiters in the restaurant.

title: Great Palace
review: We stayed in this hotel in last leg of Jaisalmer trip for a night. It was a well maintained hotel and I have got the privilage of staying in the suite which has been used by former kings as their reading suite. It has a beautiful museum which has free entry for guests. Food was OK. Resturant service was not upto mark.

title: Bad quality of service
review: The place is ok for a night's stay but the service & attitude is not at all palatable with a Welcome Heritage property. Food is below average in the buffet. Absolutely no value for money.

title: Cannot imagine a more beautiful hotel - lucky us!
review: A stunning hotel, absolutely beautiful old palace with external carvings, pretty gardens, horses, cows, a museum, fantastic!

title: Good place to visit
review: The Mandir Palace is half hotel half museum. We went to the museum and saw old items at the time of the King. The museum is not that great and most of the times it is not crowded. There is an entry ticket of Rs. 50 per person and Rs. 30 additional for taking photos. It is not a big museum and would take less than an hour to see it. The carving on the walls and pillars is amazing.

title: A heritage hotel where some good bollywood movies have been shot
review: The Mirchiseth's haveli of Sarfarosh movie fame has made this place attract tourist. Now a heritage hotel houses its guests and also has a section open for tourists

title: Easily accessible...,
review: This  palace is easily accessible from anywhere in the town.. it is really a pleasure to  walk in the small lanes and bazaar and suddenly you will see the mandir palace. What an architectural beauty..! The intricacies created in the sandstone stuctures are amazing! We are very happy that we didn't miss it.

title: Excellent but TOO Expensive
review: This is as of December 2015.

title: Not worth the price
review: This palace is the residence of the Maharaja of Jaisalmer, with a part of it turned to hotel and a very small part as museum. They charge entry and camera ticket for it, it's best to just go to place, click pictures and come back, no need to buy tickets

title: another beautiful palace
review: This is another beautiful palace in Jaisalmer. Take your time to walk through the palace, it has the weapons, clothing, utensils etc used by the emperors. There also are beautiful photographs in a hall of the kings. This is a must see place.

title: Fancy living with a king, ha! But can he get a better chef?
review: Right so this is where the ex-royal family lives. Half the place is their abode, the other half is converted to a hotel. Its very nice architecture. The rooms are clean and big. The staff is cheerful and helpful. But the food leaves something to be desired. I understand that oil's cheap at the moment; but a little less of it on my plate perhaps? But all considered, its value for money. I recommend.

title: Beatiful
review: A location I missed on a previous trip - it was a lovely surprise. Part of it is a hotel, but the area open to public is well maintained and interesting

title: Chanced upon it
review: We were walking through the small streets of Jaisalmer and chanced upon the Mandir Palace. We were told that part of the Palace is the current Maharaja's residence and part is a museum and a hotel. We didn't go inside the museum but the Palace looked beautful from the outside. We decided to have dinner nearby overlooking the Mandir Palace!

title: Excellent place to visit
review: Its the place of royal families and its now divided in 2 parts ,an hotel and museum. Beautiful place to visit and stay.

title: Excellent place to visit (and stay)
review: We stayed here, but rather sounding biased, the Mandir Palace has beautiful ornate carvings on the exterior and the museum preserves some royal antiques. It is quite beautiful and provides and experience in itself. Must go!

title: This is a must see
review: Good display of history and very well maintained. One must try if stay for two days in Jaisalmer. Good photography attraction.

title: Quaint Haveli Palace
review: I was told that the ruler built 5 havelis (mini palaces) for each son.  This is one of them. Not large (after seeing those at Jaipur), but has a certain class and style and makes one realise the Royal approach back then. Part of the Haveli is now a Heritage Hotel and the a small part serves as the museum. Some interesting artefacts and a lovely courtyard.  Horses kept around as riding is a popular sport with hotel guests here.

title: Nice Palace
review: This palace is nice especially at night. This also serves as an hotel. If you are planning a royal experience, you can stay at this place.

title: Nice Palace
review: It's a hotel which is very well maintained. You can see the museum which is inside the mandir palace. It's an amazing for photograhpy.

title: Magnificent architecture, nice room and pool setting, excellent location
review: We staid 2 nights in this awesome palace that makes you feel like a princess! beautiful sunset on the rooftop, peaceful retreat after the busy citadel and old city!

title: Part of it is inaccessible being a hotel.
review: Also known as Tazia Towers. It has very good philigri work. Also the window arches and balcony architecture are worth viewing.

title: A good place to visit but not that remarkable
review: Though the overall palace is nice and so as the museum the tour itself is very short and most of the property is not open for public as it is heritage hotel.

title: What you're allowed to see is fabulous.
review: Most of the palace is closed off, either used by the expensive hotel or lived in by the maharaja. But the part you are allowed to see is just gorgeous, beautifully carved facades of golden stone.

title: Quiet place
review: The Mandir palace is very less crowded and visited by less number of tourists. The place is used as a hotel but some part of it is open for visit by tourists. The front side is very quiet with shade of trees and horses tied up.

title: Majestic, A Fine Display of Exquisite Architecture and Craftsmanship
review: Mandir Palace is a fine display of exquisite architecture and craftsmanship of the highest standard. It is also a sort of a museum, and has many articles of the era gone by on display. Large cauldrons, guns, artifacts, paintings, furniture, spears, containers trunks, jewelry and clothes can be seen.

title: great liitle find
review: i really enjoyed this , realised that you can stay here only after we booked , seems to have a lot of amzing history and character and is in the centre of jaisalmer, near clock tower

title: Palace of King
review: This is Palace of present king of Jaisalmer Royal family. One part is residence and the other part is a museum. As usual, the Museum is like any museum of other Royal families. But it seems to be little neglected as there was hardly any visitor in this Palace when we visited it. Even there was only one attendant to help us take a round of the museum;

title: Display of Antiques
review: Mandir palace is located inside the city near gandhi chowk and trio restuarent so easy to locate. Overall a good display of antiques inside it

title: Staying in a former Maharajah Palace
review: Great place to explore Jaisalmer. Impressive building, nice rooms and a super view on Jaisalmer fort, either from the balcony of our room or the rooftop restaurant, where we had dinner twice. Nice people.

title: Incredibly beautiful palace hotel in the heart of Jaisalmer
review: My favorite hotel in our recent trip.  It is a palace, the family still live in part of it.  Staying within such beauty is a rare thing, would 100% recommend this hotel to friends.  Had a lovely pool and the food really was excellent.  We have stayed in 4 Welcome Heritage hotels now and they have all been different but great.  Wifi not great but that should not put you off staying.  Also has a great rooftop restaurant.

title: Beautiful place must stay here
review: One of the most beautiful places I have stayed. Very courteous staff and helpful. Must visit the terrace restaurant which gives you a beautiful view of Jaisalmer Fort- and the food is delicious.

title: Best place with quality services
review: We choose to stay at the hotel in a situation when we were short of accommodation. We personally visited the property to look for accommodation and get connected with Mr. Bhojraj Singh who handles the booking and all other related stuff. He offered us quality services in competitive price in Kalyan Bhawan (subsidiary of Heritage Mandir Palace) for 4 rooms in such a crisis situation and peak season in Jaisalmer. He handles both Mandir Palace (heritage) and Kalyan Bhawan (best place with economic prices) property. He is of very helping nature and stand by his commitments. The breakfast was also of great quality and variety. The staff at restaurant was also friendly. I will definitely recommend this place to stay. FYI we were group of 9 adults and 2 young kids (2, 7 yr). It was very easy for us to get food for kids as per our customization because of helping staff working under supervision of Mr. Bhojraj Singh Ji.

title: Not value for money....nothing special...
review: Ticket price is very high but not worth it...there is very small section for tourists...major section is hotel and private guest....if you want to take only selfies or photo then go otherwise it is wasting of money....very small place with high cost...not worth it really

title: Wonderfully maintained place
review: It is a great place for good foots.  Very well maintained and well mannered assistants to explain details

title: Beautiful heritage Motel,  perfect for family of 6 including grandma
review: Thank you to the Mandir Palace management and staff who looked after our family so beautifully.  We really appreciated your genuine care and concern, and thoughtful manners.  Want to stay again!

title: Nice place
review: So nice place to explore Jaisalmer, Impressive building with beautiful carving, super view of Jaisalmer fort, all staff members are so Nice.

title: Do not go-tourist place but waste
review: This is a not so interesting history place as it's portrayed, the tickets are costly. The place can be covered in 15 mins ; displays lots of things from some kingdom like utensils camera furniture photographs etc.

title: Staying in a former Maharajah Palace
review: Great place to explore Jaisalmer. Impressive building, nice rooms and a super view on Jaisalmer fort, either from the balcony of our room or the rooftop restaurant, where we had dinner twice. Nice people.

title: Incredibly beautiful palace hotel in the heart of Jaisalmer
review: My favorite hotel in our recent trip.  It is a palace, the family still live in part of it.  Staying within such beauty is a rare thing, would 100% recommend this hotel to friends.  Had a lovely pool and the food really was excellent.  We have stayed in 4 Welcome Heritage hotels now and they have all been different but great.  Wifi not great but that should not put you off staying.  Also has a great rooftop restaurant.

title: Best place with quality services
review: We choose to stay at the hotel in a situation when we were short of accommodation. We personally visited the property to look for accommodation and get connected with Mr. Bhojraj Singh who handles the booking and all other related stuff. He offered us quality services in competitive price in Kalyan Bhawan (subsidiary of Heritage Mandir Palace) for 4 rooms in such a crisis situation and peak season in Jaisalmer. He handles both Mandir Palace (heritage) and Kalyan Bhawan (best place with economic prices) property. He is of very helping nature and stand by his commitments. The breakfast was also of great quality and variety. The staff at restaurant was also friendly. I will definitely recommend this place to stay. FYI we were group of 9 adults and 2 young kids (2, 7 yr). It was very easy for us to get food for kids as per our customization because of helping staff working under supervision of Mr. Bhojraj Singh Ji.

title: Beautiful place must stay here
review: One of the most beautiful places I have stayed. Very courteous staff and helpful. Must visit the terrace restaurant which gives you a beautiful view of Jaisalmer Fort- and the food is delicious.

title: Not value for money....nothing special...
review: Ticket price is very high but not worth it...there is very small section for tourists...major section is hotel and private guest....if you want to take only selfies or photo then go otherwise it is wasting of money....very small place with high cost...not worth it really

title: Beautiful heritage Motel,  perfect for family of 6 including grandma
review: Thank you to the Mandir Palace management and staff who looked after our family so beautifully.  We really appreciated your genuine care and concern, and thoughtful manners.  Want to stay again!

title: Do not go-tourist place but waste
review: This is a not so interesting history place as it's portrayed, the tickets are costly. The place can be covered in 15 mins ; displays lots of things from some kingdom like utensils camera furniture photographs etc.

title: Wonderfully maintained place
review: It is a great place for good foots.  Very well maintained and well mannered assistants to explain details

title: Nice place
review: So nice place to explore Jaisalmer, Impressive building with beautiful carving, super view of Jaisalmer fort, all staff members are so Nice.

title: Incredibly beautiful palace hotel in the heart of Jaisalmer
review: My favorite hotel in our recent trip.  It is a palace, the family still live in part of it.  Staying within such beauty is a rare thing, would 100% recommend this hotel to friends.  Had a lovely pool and the food really was excellent.  We have stayed in 4 Welcome Heritage hotels now and they have all been different but great.  Wifi not great but that should not put you off staying.  Also has a great rooftop restaurant.

title: Staying in a former Maharajah Palace
review: Great place to explore Jaisalmer. Impressive building, nice rooms and a super view on Jaisalmer fort, either from the balcony of our room or the rooftop restaurant, where we had dinner twice. Nice people.

title: Best place with quality services
review: We choose to stay at the hotel in a situation when we were short of accommodation. We personally visited the property to look for accommodation and get connected with Mr. Bhojraj Singh who handles the booking and all other related stuff. He offered us quality services in competitive price in Kalyan Bhawan (subsidiary of Heritage Mandir Palace) for 4 rooms in such a crisis situation and peak season in Jaisalmer. He handles both Mandir Palace (heritage) and Kalyan Bhawan (best place with economic prices) property. He is of very helping nature and stand by his commitments. The breakfast was also of great quality and variety. The staff at restaurant was also friendly. I will definitely recommend this place to stay. FYI we were group of 9 adults and 2 young kids (2, 7 yr). It was very easy for us to get food for kids as per our customization because of helping staff working under supervision of Mr. Bhojraj Singh Ji.

title: Beautiful place must stay here
review: One of the most beautiful places I have stayed. Very courteous staff and helpful. Must visit the terrace restaurant which gives you a beautiful view of Jaisalmer Fort- and the food is delicious.

title: Wonderfully maintained place
review: It is a great place for good foots.  Very well maintained and well mannered assistants to explain details

title: Not value for money....nothing special...
review: Ticket price is very high but not worth it...there is very small section for tourists...major section is hotel and private guest....if you want to take only selfies or photo then go otherwise it is wasting of money....very small place with high cost...not worth it really

title: Beautiful heritage Motel,  perfect for family of 6 including grandma
review: Thank you to the Mandir Palace management and staff who looked after our family so beautifully.  We really appreciated your genuine care and concern, and thoughtful manners.  Want to stay again!

title: Do not go-tourist place but waste
review: This is a not so interesting history place as it's portrayed, the tickets are costly. The place can be covered in 15 mins ; displays lots of things from some kingdom like utensils camera furniture photographs etc.

title: Nice place
review: So nice place to explore Jaisalmer, Impressive building with beautiful carving, super view of Jaisalmer fort, all staff members are so Nice.

title: Incredibly beautiful palace hotel in the heart of Jaisalmer
review: My favorite hotel in our recent trip.  It is a palace, the family still live in part of it.  Staying within such beauty is a rare thing, would 100% recommend this hotel to friends.  Had a lovely pool and the food really was excellent.  We have stayed in 4 Welcome Heritage hotels now and they have all been different but great.  Wifi not great but that should not put you off staying.  Also has a great rooftop restaurant.

title: Staying in a former Maharajah Palace
review: Great place to explore Jaisalmer. Impressive building, nice rooms and a super view on Jaisalmer fort, either from the balcony of our room or the rooftop restaurant, where we had dinner twice. Nice people.

title: Beautiful place must stay here
review: One of the most beautiful places I have stayed. Very courteous staff and helpful. Must visit the terrace restaurant which gives you a beautiful view of Jaisalmer Fort- and the food is delicious.
